name: The Life of Sarah Mackenzie Quiz | Television | 15 Questions

questions.text: How did Mac and General Cresswell know each other?
questions.correct: He was the Judge Advocate in Okinawa
options: She picked him as the new JAG
questions.explanation:
He was the Judge Advocate in Okinawa.

	In "Whole New Ballgame", viewers discover that General Cresswell was the Staff Judge Advocate in Okinawa and that he knew of her affair with Colonel Farrow.

questions.text: In "Capital Crime", to whom did Mac admit that she was in love with Harm?
questions.explanation:
Sturgis.

	While Sturgis and Mac were in her office, she blurted out that she was in love with Harm and then asked Sturgis not to say anything to Harm.

questions.text: In what episode did Mac appeared as a judge?
questions.explanation:
Ready Or Not.

	Mac became a judge in the eighth season episode "Ready or Not". Catherine Bell was pregnant during this season and Donald Bellisario was looking for ways to hide her pregnancy.

questions.text: Mac said she wanted a simple and good life, a great career, good man, and lots and lots of _________________.
questions.explanation:
Comfortable shoes.

	Mac admitted this to Harm in the third season episode "Vanished" while they were on board the USS Coral Sea. She and Harm discussed it again outside of Bud and Harriet's apartment in the fourth season finale "Goodbyes".

questions.text: When Mac served under Colonel Farrow in Okinawa, what was her rank?
questions.explanation:
First Lieutenant.

	In "People vs. Mac", it's said that Mac was a First Lieutenant when she and Farrow had an affair in Okinawa.

questions.text: By series end, how many times had Mac been married?
questions.explanation:
1.

	Mac was married to Chris Ragle, but never got divorced. He was killed in "People vs. Mac. Mac never married Mic Brumby. Mac and Harm were engaged at the end of "JAG".

questions.text: When did Mac start telling time without a watch?
questions.explanation:
5th grade.

	In "Psychic Warrior", Mac revealed that she taught herself to tell time without a watch so she would know when it was time for recess.

True.

	This fact about Mac is discovered in "Silent Service".

questions.text: What was the name of Mac's friend that died after a drunk driving incident?
questions.explanation:
Eddie.

	Mac explained to Harm in "Full Engagement" about the night that she and Eddie were in a drunk driving accident. Eddie was killed and her Uncle Matt took her to Red Rock Mesa to dry out.

questions.text: What was the name of Mac's childhood dog that left with her mother?
questions.explanation:
Ruggles.

	The dog Mac had as a child was left at a boarding house by her mother, but in "Front and Center", Mic gave Mac a retired police dog named Jingo.

questions.text: Who did Mac say this to, "Women's intuition isn't a joke; it's a matter of survival"?
questions.explanation:
Admiral.

	Mac was explaining to the Admiral in "Defenseless" the difference between men and women leaving a building.

questions.text: In "Impact", Mac told Harm that 'it's no Tomcat'?
questions.explanation:
Porsche.

	Before Mac left "JAG", she and Harm said goodbye outside the building. When Harm saw Dalton pull up, he made the comment about Dalton's car and Mac answered him with "it's no Tomcat."

questions.text: Was Mac the Admiral's Chief of Staff?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	"The Return" marks the return of Harm to lawyer status and Mac becomes the Admiral's Chief of Staff.

questions.text: What award was Mac given after the rescue mission in Indonesia?
questions.explanation:
Meritorious Service Medal.

	The only medal Mac does not have is the Purple Heart. The other three medals she wears on the left side of her uniform. She gave the Meritorious Service Medal to Lilyana.

questions.text: In "Enemy Below", Mac told Harm she wanted to die in a blaze of glory like Butch and Sundance.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Mac: "I want to die like Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid in a blaze of glory against impossible odds with something really important at stake."
